Site_Notes: Change to Advanced Gentrification.  This tract rapidly changed between 2013 and 2018 so it was likely missed in the 2012-17 ACS data.
CommunityComments: Change to Advanced Gentrification.  This tract rapidly changed between 2013 and 2018 so it was likely missed in the 2012-17 ACS data.

Site_Notes: Change to At Risk of Gentrification.  Based on adjacency to rapidly changeing neighborhoods and already higher home sale prices than other nearby low-income neighborhoods.
CommunityComments: Change to At Risk of Gentrification.  Based on adjacency to rapidly changeing neighborhoods and already higher home sale prices than other nearby low-income neighborhoods.

Site_Notes: Change to Ongoing Gentrification.  This tract was already showing signs of gentrification in 2013 (based on our analysis).  It has been gentrifying over the proceeding years (albeit not as rapidly as 13121004100 to its west).
CommunityComments: Change to Ongoing Gentrification.  This tract was already showing signs of gentrification in 2013 (based on our analysis).  It has been gentrifying over the proceeding years (albeit not as rapidly as 13121004100 to its west).

Miriam_Student_Notes: Labeled as stable/moderate but i think should be recategorized as at risk or becoming exclusive. North Center neighborhood has rising rents
CommunityComments: Labeled as stable/moderate but i think should be recategorized as at risk or becoming exclusive. North Center neighborhood has rising rents

Miriam_Student_Notes: Says on early/ongoing but very progressed gentrification. Borders the heart of Logan Square, massive new development of apartments + Target right around the corner
CommunityComments: Says on early/ongoing but very progressed gentrification. Borders the heart of Logan Square, massive new development of apartments + Target right around the corner

Miriam_Student_Notes: Tract is labeled low/ moderate income but would expect it to be labeled as early gentrification. Given its proximity to Humboldt Park, we would expect that property values would be higher and that this tract would be gentrifying
CommunityComments: Tract is labeled low/ moderate income but would expect it to be labeled as early gentrification. Given its proximity to Humboldt Park, we would expect that property values would be higher and that this tract would be gentrifying

Site_Notes: (Just using this tract as an example for the area - south/sw Adams County) This area is interesting because we hear from the community, and have seen in some education data that while the community profile may not be demonstrating displacement of residents, it is actually happening. The replacement just happens to be those with similar lower-incomes.
CommunityComments: (Just using this tract as an example for the area - south/sw Adams County) This area is interesting because we hear from the community, and have seen in some education data that while the community profile may not be demonstrating displacement of residents, it is actually happening. The replacement just happens to be those with similar lower-incomes.

Site_Notes: Historically exclusive, old money country club area
CommunityComments: Historically exclusive, old money country club area

Site_Notes: I'm confused about this tract's designation.This is an area that is definitely lower-income, and does not hold very desirable housing stock.
CommunityComments: This is an area that is definitely lower-income, and does not hold very desirable housing stock.

Site_Notes: This area has seen immense development and while there are some subsidized properties, the units coming to the market have definitely elevated existing unit prices that have pushed long-time residents out
CommunityComments: This area has seen immense development and while there are some subsidized properties, the units coming to the market have definitely elevated existing unit prices that have pushed long-time residents out

Site_Notes: This tract contains the regional Anschutz Medical Campus. The majority of the pre-existing units (many of which were mobile homes) have since been demolished, and what has been built new would definitely not consititute a low-income status. If anything, this tract would warrant risk of becoming exclusive, rather than the one above (north).
CommunityComments: This tract contains the regional Anschutz Medical Campus. The majority of the pre-existing units (many of which were mobile homes) have since been demolished, and what has been built new would definitely not consititute a low-income status. If anything, this tract would warrant risk of becoming exclusive, rather than the one above (north).

Site_Notes: This tract is at the center of massive development in Denver, and the rate of displacement in and around it has been immense. The local Boys and Girls Club has seen a 60% drop in membership in the past eight years. At a minimum this (and others below) need to be classified as "At Risk of Gentrification".
CommunityComments: This tract is at the center of massive development in Denver, and the rate of displacement in and around it has been immense. The local Boys and Girls Club has seen a 60% drop in membership in the past eight years. At a minimum this (and others below) need to be classified as "At Risk of Gentrification".

Site_Notes: This tract is part of the Globeville/Elyria-Swansea neighborhoods, and in the middle of the I70 redevelopment project (if you are not familiar, the highway will be buried along this stretch of Denver). This effort has brought not only eminent domain, but a lot of speculation to the community, purchasing/displacing residents in the process. At a minimum this (and others below) need to be classified as "At Risk of Gentrification".
CommunityComments: This tract is part of the Globeville/Elyria-Swansea neighborhoods, and in the middle of the I70 redevelopment project (if you are not familiar, the highway will be buried along this stretch of Denver).
